result.execSummary:
The defendant Marlin R Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
09-19-2016/ The Court ordered the fine, costs and surcharges to be paid on or before 03-30-2017 at $100 per month commencing 09-30-2016.
All other cinditions imposed shall remain the same. 

Court costs and victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge  are to be paid by 9/16/2016.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civl judgment.
*restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. stats to apply for work, school, community service and childcare.

Provide a DNA sample,  pay related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.

Order GRANTING the fine, costs, and surcharges shall be paid on or before March 30, 2017 at $100.00 per month commencing 09-30-2016; signed and filed.  
Copies to the District Attorney's Office and defendant.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, calendar successor, for review.  mag
LETTER FROM DEFENDANT REQUESTING PAYMENT PLAN. kl
Decision and Order Denying Request for SEntence Reduction received and filed.  Copies mailed to defendant and the State./ds
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Daniel L. Konkol, Br. 44, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for sentence reduction.
Court signed order denying defendant's motion for release privileges. Copies forwarded to the parties. lr
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, calendar successor, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for additional release privileges and release hours.

Defendant Marlin R Thompson in court with attorney Jeffrey William Purnell.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 1 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply`for work, school, community service and child care.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 9/16/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 9/16/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Marlin R Thompson in court with attorney Jeffrey William Purnell. Nate Adamson for Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
ADA Loebel had a family emergency. Case rescheduled for SENTENCING on 9/16/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Marlin R Thompson in court with attorney Jeffrey W Purnell.  Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing.  Parties have been notified that effective August 3, 2014, this case is reassigned to Judge J.D. Watts, Branch 15, Room G-55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Court vacates 7-9-2014 jury trial.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-19-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marlin R Thompson in court with attorney Jeffrey W Purnell.  Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

After further research, defense has no valid motions on this case.   Pretrial scheduling order received and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 9, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Marlin R Thompson in court with attorney Jeffrey W Purnell.  Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Motions to be filed by 6-3-14.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marlin R Thompson in court with attorney Jeffrey W Purnell.  Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense needs time to review discovery.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant Marlin R Thompson in court with attorney Jeffrey William Purnell.  Karen Ann Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
 Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Marlin R Thompson in court with attorney Jeffrey W. Purnell.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/21/14 @ 1:30pm
